pr_title: DROOLS-5253: [DMN Designer] Copied node should be distinguished from original one

timeline.message: Supporting simple suffix mechanism for cloned nodes
Refactoring: renaming methods/variables for better understanding
Empty prefix in the name when name is empty

timeline.bodyText: Just a thought, but please see DefaultValueUtilities.updateNewNodeName(..) that is currently used to ensure new elements have unique names. It might be re-usable here.
timeline.author: manstis

replies.bodyText:
@manstis I briefly looked at DefaultValueUtilities implementation.
The method updateNewNodeName seems to be not suitable for the copy case, since it is working only with default names (i.e. names assigned when node gets created).
In the copy case you can change a node name to whatever value, and then suffix sequence must work as well.
There are other two methods getExistingNodeNames and getMaxUnusedIndex that maybe can work well with this specific use-case.
I need to perform some trial and check if the result is the same.
replies.author: vpellegrino

replies.bodyText: OK, fair point. It was a suggestion, re-use if and as appropriate.
replies.author: manstis

timeline.message: Fixing expected result when copying node
Calling DefaultValueUtilities for getting max unused index, to be used in the suffix

timeline.author: dupliaka
dupliaka

timeline.bodyText:
Just a suggestion :
You can keep one return to have only one exit point.
timeline.author: dupliaka

replies.bodyText: In this case, for readability I prefer to have multiple returns, instead of a non-final variable to keep the result to return
replies.author: vpellegrino

timeline.bodyText: hasText named like boolean variable that checks for text. Probably we could provide more context - wise declaration?
timeline.author: dupliaka

timeline.message: Intermediate variables should be final + better name for HasText instance

timeline.bodyText: Small suggestion to investigate how could we avoid a generic exception since that would be hard to inspect if something would happen if exec will throw any exception like IndexOutOfBounds or buildNameWithIncrementedSuffixIndex throw some exception(bcs it would probably just skipped)
timeline.author: dupliaka

replies.bodyText:
@dupliaka thank you for your question.
Let me explain a bit why I put this generic catch block.
I put this try-catch block because of the regex matcher.
This exception in reality should never happen.
It is only a way to way to unblock cloning mechanism in case any issue with the matcher occurs.
The strategy here, only in the remote case an exception gets thrown  is:

Softly print exception details
Return a fallback name for the copied node
replies.author: vpellegrino

timeline.bodyText: Could you please update javadoc on it as well?
timeline.author: dupliaka

replies.bodyText:
Which information would you update?
Nothing seems to be changed from doc perspective
replies.author: vpellegrino

replies.bodyText: I mean that for new node name. It is not clear that this should comply with the validation mechanisms
replies.author: dupliaka

timeline.message: Giving meaningful name to constants used for indexes

timeline.bodyText:
This test is a reproducer for https://issues.redhat.com/browse/DROOLS-4424
If your change affect this then we can remove the comment and close the bug.
Let me only check it manually first.
timeline.author: dupliaka
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -250,6 +250,7 @@ public void testCopyAndPaste() throws Exception {
         expandDecisionNavigatorDock();

replies.bodyText: I retested it manually I think you can remove the comment so now it is not a reproducer. Just a test.
replies.author: dupliaka

timeline.bodyText:
Suggestion
Would you mind to add a test for case if the matcher throws an exception in composeUniqueNodeName()?
timeline.author: dupliaka

replies.bodyText:
Looked at code of com.google.gwt.regexp.shared.RegExp#exec method.
There is no explicit exception thrown, so I am going to remove the try-catch block.
replies.author: vpellegrino

timeline.bodyText: Thank you for updating the test @vpellegrino @dupliaka !
timeline.author: jomarko
